"Filters" tab
The “Filters” tab is used to configure filters and sort type instances. Only sorted and filtered values will be displayed in the registry.
Learn more about advanced custom filtering in the article
“Setting up filtering panel in the registry”
.
Setting
Purpose
Registry filter type
Specifies the type of registry column filter. Possible values:
excel;
In case of working with
type of column filter “Excel ”
in the registry it is possible to add a filter fragment. That is, the end user can multiselect values. The action is performed similarly to working with filter in XLSX document.
There is also data filtering available to the user in working with attributes using string filters, for more information see the article
“Working with the object registry”
.
by row;
The “By row” filter displays data based on the value specified in the filter row:
unfiltered.
With this setting, there is no filtering tool
.
Additional custom filters
Specifying the filters that will be available to the user in the registry control panel.
Previously created filters are selected using the drop-down list, creation of new filters is available through the parameter action menu.
Adding custom filters will open a modal window to create filtering based on
condition-tree
.
Creating additional filters will be available to the user directly in the type instance registry, for more information see the
“Working with the Object Registry”
article.
Display the advanced search when opening the registry
Boolean attribute that determines whether an advanced search or filter panel is displayed.
The default value is “No”, with the search bar collapsed
Filtering visuals
Defining a visual for
configuring the filtering panel
of the registry.
The option is available when the “Display the advanced search when opening the registry” option is active.
Preset filters
Filter type
Defining the filtering method. The radiobutton type switch selects one of the three types, as a result the corresponding field for filter selection is displayed in the settings:
Filtering algorithm;
SQL condition;
Condition tree.
Algorithm for data filtering
Entering (selecting) an algorithm for data filtering. For more details,
“Configuring the filtering conditions”
.

As a result of filtering, only objects that satisfy the specified condition will be displayed in the registry:
The parameter is displayed when “Filtering algorithm” filtering type is selected.
Condition tree
Configuring filtering using the boolean condition constructor, for more information, see the
“Condition tree”
article.
The parameter is displayed when “Condition tree” filtering type is selected.
SQL based filter
Selecting SQL-based filter.
The parameter is displayed when “SQL condition” filtering type is selected.
After saving changes by clicking the
button, the registry will be updated according to the applied settings.
